result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brent Martavius McCoy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING  (37 pages) commencing MARCH 28, 2014  received and filed.  Filed in 13CF005392.

Defendant Brent Martavius McCoy in court with attorney James T. Moczydlowski.  Defendant Brent Martavius McCoy in custody.  Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Exhibit #1 offered and received during the sentencing as to Case# 13CF005392.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders this case DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing as to Case# 13CF005392.
Clerk:  jms
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING  (11 pages) commencing FEBRUARY 20, 2014 received and filed.

Attorney James T. Moczydlowski in court, defendant Brent Martavius McCoy not in court, in custody.  No Assistant District Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
NO COURT FILE.
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 3/28/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney James T. Moczydlowski in court, defendant Brent Martavius McCoy not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case transferred to br 15 for global resolution with 13CF5392.  Status conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brent Martavius McCoy in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Brent Martavius McCoy in custody.  Sara Schroeder for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the correction of the city of "Franklin" on page (1).  Sworn for the state:Fabian Garivay-MCSD Corrections Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brent Martavius McCoy in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Brent Martavius McCoy in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brent Martavius McCoy
Current: 635 W Center Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209 United States  (Effective: 02-12-2014)
Prior: House Of Correction 8885 S. 68th Street, Franklin, WI 53132
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
